description: The sacred land of Skypiea, originally part of Jaya before being launched into the sky 400 years ago. The Upper Ruins area is where Ohm's Ordeal of Iron takes place, now enclosed by his White-Barbed Iron Deathmatch cage.

keyEvents.title: White-Barbed Iron Deathmatch Created
keyEvents.description: Ohm commands Holy to create a massive dome of barbed wire Iron Cloud that completely encases the Upper Ruins battlefield, trapping all combatants.
keyEvents.significance: Transforms the location into an inescapable death arena.

keyEvents.title: Raki Defeated by Enel
keyEvents.description: Enel electrocutes Raki outside the barbed wire cage while Wyper watches helplessly from inside.
keyEvents.significance: Shows Enel's dominance and the tragedy of the Shandian warriors.

keyEvents.title: Zoro and Wyper Clash
keyEvents.description: Zoro and Wyper fight each other in the Upper Ruins while both try to reach Nola.
keyEvents.significance: Demonstrates the chaotic nature of the multi-sided conflict.

keyEvents.title: Ohm Attacks Zoro and Wyper
keyEvents.description: Ohm and Holy launch their attack on Zoro and Wyper, beginning the true Ordeal of Iron battle.
keyEvents.significance: Starts the climactic confrontation in this location.

statusHistory.reason: Ongoing battlefield during the Skypiea conflict

description: The interior stomach of Nola, the ancient giant snake that has lived on Upper Yard for over 400 years. A cavernous space with digestive fluids where several characters become trapped.

keyEvents.title: Inside Nola's Stomach
keyEvents.description: Nami, Gan Fall, Aisa, and Pierre find themselves trapped inside Nola's stomach after being swallowed, searching for a way to escape.
keyEvents.significance: Establishes the secondary location where trapped characters must survive.

keyEvents.title: Discovery of Luffy Inside Nola
keyEvents.description: The group discovers Luffy is also inside Nola's stomach, and his fighting is what's causing the snake to rampage violently.
keyEvents.significance: Explains the mystery of Nola's erratic behavior and provides comic relief.
